entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, 2 {@item Dagger|XPHB|Daggers}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, {@item Bolts (20)|XPHB|20 Bolts}, {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|XPHB|Case}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 6 GP; or (B) 50 GP
{@i A Master of Psionic Power}

Psions weave magic and extraordinary powers through the power of their minds. They develop their minds as fonts of power that manifest spells and grow stronger over the course of their adventuring careers. You can find everything you need to play one of these psionic powerhouses in the next few sections.

entries.name: What is a Psion?
entries: Psions are spellcasters who use innate mental powers to gain extraordinary abilities and unleash the magic of their minds. Psions and their magic (sometimes called "psionics") can trace their history back to the appendix of the first edition {@i Player's Handbook}, and a psionics-using class first appeared in {@i The Complete Psionics Handbook} in 1991. Psionics have taken numerous forms in D&D, from alternative magic systems to options that dovetail with other D&D rules. In the fifth edition, psychic power is synonymous with magic, and the magic of the mind flavors numerous spells, monsters, and subclasses—like the {@class Fighter|XPHB|Psi Warrior Fighter|Psi Warrior|XPHB} and the {@class Sorcerer|XPHB|Aberrant Sorcery Sorcerer|Aberrant|XPHB} in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB}. In this edition, the Psion is a spellcaster who interfaces with magic and spellcasting similarly to other classes in the game.

This UA provides the Psion with unique twists to spellcasting using Psionic Energy Dice and the {@classFeature Spellcasting|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion|Psionic Spellcasting} feature, carving out a space to make the Psion stand out from its spellcasting peers.

subclassFluff.name: Metamorph
entries: {@i Psychically Sculpt Life and Flesh}

subclassFluff.name: Psi Warper
entries: {@i Warp Space with the Power of Your Mind}

subclassFluff.name: Psykinetic
entries: {@i Mold Psionic Force for Creation and Destruction}

subclassFluff.name: Telepath
entries: {@i Master Tactics in the Landscape of the Mind}

classFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by your Psionic Energy Dice. Your Psion level determines the die size and number of Psionic Energy Dice you have, as shown in the Energy Die and Number of Dice columns of the Psion Features table.

Your Psionic Energy Dice are used to enhance or fuel certain Psion features. You start with two such features: {@classFeature Telekinetic Propel|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion} and {@classFeature Telepathic Connection|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion}, each of which is detailed below. Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy Dice, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when all your Psionic Energy Dice are expended.
You regain one expended Psionic Energy Die when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all of them when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Some features that use Psionic Energy Dice require your target to make a saving throw. The save DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned how to channel magical energy using the power of your mind. See the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB} for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules with Psion spells, which appear in the {@table Psion spell list|XUA2025Psion} later in the class's description.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two Psion cantrips of your choice. {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} and {@spell Telekinetic Fling|XUA2025Psion} are recommended.
Whenever you gain a Psion level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Psion cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Psion levels 10 and 14, you learn another Psion cantrip of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Psion Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Psion Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 Psion spells. {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB}, and {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Psion levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Psion Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Psion spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Psion, your list of prepared spells can include six Psion spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Psion feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Psion spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Psion level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Psion spell of an eligible level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Psion spells.

entries.name: Psionic Spellcasting
entries: When you cast a Psion spell, that spell doesn't require a Verbal or Material component, even if the spell includes "V" or "M" in its "Components" entry, except Material components that are consumed by the spell or have a cost specified in the spell.

classFeature.name: Subtle Telekinesis
entries: You know the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip. You can cast it without Somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible} when you cast it.

classFeature.name: Telekinetic Propel
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one Large or smaller creature other than you that you can see within 30 feet of yourself, and then roll one Psionic Energy Die. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed or pulled (your choice) up to a number of feet straight away from yourself equal to 5 times the number rolled. The die is expended only if the target fails the saving throw.

classFeature.name: Telepathic Connection
entries: You have {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} with a range of 5 feet. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it. For a number of minutes equal to your Psion level, the range of your {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} increases by a number of feet equal to 10 times the number rolled.

classFeature.name: Attack Mode
entries: Damage from your weapon attacks, Psion spells, and Psion features ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die to reroll a number of damage dice up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one), and you must use the new rolls.

classFeature.name: Defense Mode
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage. In addition, when you fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Psionic Energy Die; roll the Psionic Energy Die and add the number rolled to the saving throw, potentially turning a failure into a success.

classFeature.name: Psionic Discipline
entries: You learn further psionic techniques that are fueled by your Psionic Energy Dice. You gain two disciplines of your choice, such as {@optfeature Expanded Awareness|XUA2025Psion} and {@optfeature Id Insinuation|XUA2025Psion}. Disciplines are described in the "Psionic Discipline Options" section later in this class's description.
You can use only one Discipline each turn and only once per turn unless otherwise noted in one of those options.
Whenever you gain a Psion level, you can replace one of your Psionic Discipline options with one you don't know. You gain two more options at Psion level 10 and two more at Psion level 17.

classFeature.name: Psionic Discipline Options
entries: Psionic Discipline options appear in alphabetical order.

classFeature.name: Psionic Modes
entries: You have honed your psionic powers to act as both a shield and a weapon in battle. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose one of the following modes, granting you certain benefits for 1 minute or until you use this feature again:
You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Psion Subclass
entries: You gain a Psion subclass of your choice. The {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psi Warper|Psi Warper|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psykinetic|Psykinetic|XUA2025Psion}, and {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Telepath|Telepath|XUA2025Psion} subclasses are detailed after this class's description. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Psion levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Psion level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Psion levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Psionic Restoration
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can regain expended Psionic Energy Dice, but no more than a number equal to half your number of dice (round down). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Psion Subclass.

classFeature.name: Psionic Surge
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and regain one expended use of {@classFeature Psionic Modes|Psion|XUA2025Psion|2|XUA2025Psion}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Psionic Discipline
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional Psionic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Psion Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Psion Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Psionic Discipline
entries: At 17th level, you learn an additional Psionic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Energy Resistance|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Enkindled Lifeforce
entries: Once per turn, when you expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it for a Psion feature or Psionic Discipline, you can expend two of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to roll two additional Psionic Energy Dice and add the numbers rolled to the total.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorph
entries: Your mastery of psionic powers turns inward. Your own flesh becomes like clay to you, and you mold it to turn it into the perfect vessel of your psionic powers. Experience in manipulating your life energy also enables you to adjust the life force of friends and foes alike.

subclassFeature.name: Extend Limbs
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die. For the next minute, you gain the following benefits.

items.name: Reach
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet.

items.name: Speed
entries: Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

items.name: Touch
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of Touch and a casting time of an action, you can make the spell's range 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorph Spells
entries: When you reach a Psion level specified in the {@table Metamorph Spells|XUA2025Psion} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Organic Weapons
entries: You can shape your limbs into weapons. Whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action or make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, you can reform your free hand into one of the following organic weapons: Bone Blade, Flesh Maul, or Viscera Launcher. Your limb immediately returns to its previous form after your Organic Weapon hits or misses its target.

Whenever you attack with the weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity; and you can cause the weapon to deal Psychic damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Bone Blade
entries: A blade made of bone springs from your forearm or extends from your hand. The blade counts as a Simple Melee weapon with the {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse} property, and it deals {@damage 1d8} Piercing damage on a hit. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll you make with the blade if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh Maul
entries: Your fist and forearm coalesce into a hardened mass of flesh and bone. The maul counts as a Simple Melee weapon and deals {@damage 1d10} Bludgeoning damage on a hit. A creature hit by the maul has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next Strength or Constitution saving throw it makes before the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Viscera Launcher
entries: Your hand and forearm transform into a crossbow made of muscle and sinew that fires bolts of bile. The launcher counts as a Simple Ranged weapon with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet, and it deals {@damage 1d6} Acid damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using the launcher, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Acid damage to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.
In addition, you can cast one of your Psion cantrips that has a casting time of an action in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Quickened Healing
entries: When you cast {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, you can expend two Psionic Energy Dice to change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting. When you do, you can roll one Psionic Energy Die and add the number rolled to the total amount of Hit Points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Stony Epidermis
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. In addition, choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Piercing, Poison, Slashing, or Thunder. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Stride
entries: While you aren't wearing armor, you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and you have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} and {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Flexibility
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC, and your body, along with any equipment you're wearing or carrying, becomes pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Form
entries: When you use {@subclassFeature Extend Limbs|Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion|3|XUA2025Psion}, the duration increases to 10 minutes and you gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until {@subclassFeature Extend Limbs|Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion|3|XUA2025Psion} ends.

subclassFeature.name: Life-Bending Weapons
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your {@subclassFeature Organic Weapons|Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion|3|XUA2025Psion|Organic Weapon}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it. Each creature of your choice in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, one creature of your choice in that area takes Necrotic damage equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Psi Warper
entries: Psi Warpers tune their psionic powers to manipulating the space between objects. Capable of teleporting across the battlefield and creating vacuums in space, a Psi Warper is never in one place for too long.

subclassFeature.name: Psi Warper Spells
entries: When you reach a Psion level specified in the {@table Psi Warper Spells|XUA2025Psion} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Teleportation
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again. You can also restore your use of it by expending one Psionic Energy Die (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Warp Propel
entries: When a target fails its saving throw against your {@classFeature Telekinetic Propel|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion}, instead of pushing it, you can teleport the target to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you that is horizontal to you.

subclassFeature.name: Teleporter Combat
entries: Immediately after you cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, you can cast one of your Psion cantrips that has a casting time of an action as part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Warp Space
entries: When you cast {@spell Shatter|XPHB}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die to modify the spell so that the radius of the spell's {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} becomes 20 feet.

In addition, creatures that fail the saving throw against the spell are pulled straight toward the center of the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, ending in an unoccupied space as close to center of the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} as possible.

subclassFeature.name: Duplicitous Target
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Psionic Energy Die and choose a willing creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself that doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. You and the willing creature teleport, swapping places with each other. The creature then becomes the target of the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Mass Teleportation
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you expend four Psionic Energy Dice and choose Huge or smaller creatures within 30 feet of yourself, up to a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one creature). Each of the chosen creatures is teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 150 feet of you. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} is unaffected.

subclassFeature.name: Psykinetic
entries: A Psykinetic controls their psionic powers like a malleable force. They bend their telekinetic energies into sturdy barriers and strike with the force of a battering ram.

subclassFeature.name: Psykinetic Spells
entries: When you reach a Psion level specified in the {@table Psykinetic Spells|XUA2025Psion} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Techniques
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Telekinetic Propel|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion}, you can impose one of the following effects on that target.

items.name: Boost
entries: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Disorient
entries: The target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Telekinetic Bolt
entries: If the target fails the saving throw, it takes Force damage equal to the number rolled on the Psionic Energy Die.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Attack Mode
entries: While your {@classFeature Attack Mode|Psion|XUA2025Psion|2|XUA2025Psion} is active, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet and can hover, and when you cast a Psion spell, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Rebounding Field
entries: When you cast {@spell Shield|XPHB} in response to being hit by an attack roll and cause the triggering attack to miss, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die to launch the force back at the attacker. The attacker makes a Dexterity saving throw. Roll two Psionic Energy Dice. On a failed save, the attacker takes Force damage equal to the amount rolled and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Telekinetic Crush
entries: When you cast {@spell Telekinetic Crush|XUA2025Psion}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die to modify the spell so that whether a creature fails or succeeds on the saving throw against the spell, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Heightened Telekinesis
entries: When you cast {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}, you can expend four Psionic Energy Dice to modify the spell so that it doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting, and you can target Gargantuan creatures and objects.

subclassFeature.name: Telepath
entries: Telepaths are masters of mind magic. They use their psionic powers for all matters of the mind, whether they bolster the mental defenses of allies or probe the thoughts of others undetected. A telepath can be a bastion of psionic aid or a crafty manipulator.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Infiltrator
entries: When you cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, you can expend two Psionic Energy Dice to modify the spell so that the spell doesn't require spell components or {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and the target does not know you're probing its mind if it fails the Wisdom saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Telepath Spells
entries: When you reach a Psion level specified in the {@table Telepath Spells|XUA2025Psion} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: You have {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet. When you expend a Psionic Energy Die as part of using {@classFeature Telepathic Connection|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion} to increase the range of your {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB}, for the duration of the effect, you can simultaneously contact a number of creatures equal to 1 plus the number rolled on the Psionic Energy Die.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Defense Mode
entries: While your {@classFeature Defense Mode|Psion|XUA2025Psion|2|XUA2025Psion} is active, whenever you make a saving throw, you add {@dice 1d4} to the save.

In addition, while your {@classFeature Defense Mode|Psion|XUA2025Psion|2|XUA2025Psion} is active, you can extend this benefit to creatures you are telepathically connected with using your {@classFeature Telepathic Connection|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion}.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Thoughts
entries: You add your Intelligence modifier to the damage you deal with any Psion cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Bolstering
entries: You have {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} out to 30 feet. When you or a creature you can see within range of your {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} fails an ability check or misses with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll the die, and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20}, potentially turning a failed check into a success or a miss into a hit. The Psionic Energy Die is expended only if the check succeeds or the attack hits.

subclassFeature.name: Scramble Minds
entries: When you cast {@spell Confusion|XPHB}, you can expend four Psionic Energy Dice to modify the spell so that the radius of the spell's {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} becomes 30 feet.
In addition, creatures under the effect of the spell roll {@dice 2d10|two d10s}, and you choose which roll determines their behavior on their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Biofeedback
entries: When you cast {@filter a Psion spell from the Necromancy or Transmutation school|spells|class=psion (xua25p)|school=n;t}, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it. You gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Thoughts
entries: When you cast {@filter a Psion spell from the Conjuration or Evocation school|spells|class=psion (xua25p)|school=c;v} and a creature you can see succeeds on a saving throw against the spell, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it. The creature takes Psychic damage equal to the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).

optionalfeature.name: Devilish Tongue
entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll it, and add the number rolled to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Ego Whip
entries: When a creature provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you by leaving your reach, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll one Psionic Energy Die and force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 10 feet and it subtracts the number rolled from the next damage roll it makes before the end of its next turn. The die is expended only if the target fails the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Expanded Awareness
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll it, and add the number rolled to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Id Insinuation
entries: When you cast {@filter a Psion spell from the Enchantment or Illusion school|spells|class=psion (xua25p)|school=e;i|saving throw=strength;dexterity;constitution;intelligence;wisdom;charisma} that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can expend two Psionic Energy Dice and roll one Psionic Energy Die. One target of the spell you can see subtracts the number rolled from its saving throw against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Inerrant Aim
entries: When you make an attack roll against a creature and miss, you can roll one Psionic Energy Die and add the number rolled to the attack roll, potentially turning the miss into a hit. If this causes the attack to hit, the die is expended.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Backlash
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll two Psionic Energy Dice, and subtract the number rolled on each die from the total. In addition, you can force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes Psychic damage equal to the amount rolled on the two Psionic Energy Dice.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Guards
entries: At the start of your turn, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die. Until the start of your next turn, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence saving throws. If you are {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} when you use this discipline, the condition ends on you.
When you use Psionic Guards, you can also use a different Psionic Discipline this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Swift Precognition
entries: When you cast {@filter a Psion spell from the Abjuration or Divination school with a casting time of an action|spells|class=psion (xua25p)|school=a;d|cast time=action}, you can expend a number of Psionic Energy Dice to change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting. The number of dice equals one plus the spell's level.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Mind
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll it, and add the number rolled to the ability check.

feat.name: Atmokinesis

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Lightning Jolt
entries: Once per turn when you cast a spell or hit with an attack roll and deal Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing, or Psychic damage, you can change the damage type to Lightning damage.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

feat.name: Biokinesis

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Bend Life Energy
entries: When a spell you cast restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the total {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Healing Word|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Arcane Vigor|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

feat.name: Clairsentience

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Minor Foreknowledge
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you can give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check made as part of that action. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Guidance|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

feat.name: Cryokinesis

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Ice Manipulation
entries: Once per turn when you cast a spell or hit with an attack roll and deal Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing, or Psychic damage, you can change the damage type to Cold damage.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Ray of Frost|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Armor of Agathys|XPHB} and {@spell Ice Knife|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Empath

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Emotional Sense
entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you can give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check made as part of that action. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You always have the {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast the spell, it requires no Verbal components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

feat.name: Flesh Morpher

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Flexible Flesh
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} or {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) check, you gain a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1). You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You always have the {@spell Longstrider|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast the spell, it requires no Verbal components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Alter Self|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

feat.name: Mind Whisperer

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself. You form a telepathic connection to that creature. For 1 hour, you and the chosen creature can communicate telepathically with each other while within 120 feet of each other. To understand each other, you each must mentally use a language the other knows.
Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Mind Sliver|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Psi Trickster

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Cunning Mind
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, you gain a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1). You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Psykineticist

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Psi Boost
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, you can increase your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Telekinetic Fling|XUA2025Psion} cantrip (included in this UA). You also always have the {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Pyrokinesis

otherSummary.entry: Can't Have Another Wild Talent Feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Firestarter
entries: Once per turn when you cast a spell or hit with an attack roll and deal Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing, or Psychic damage, you can change the damage type to Fire damage.

items.name: Psionic Talent
entries: You know the {@spell Produce Flame|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. When you cast these spells, they require no Verbal or Material components, and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

spell.name: Intellect Fortress
entries: For the duration, one willing creature you can see within range has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage, as well as {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Psychic Scream
entries: You unleash the power of your mind to blast the intellect of up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only. If the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage, its head explodes, assuming it has one.
At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} target repeats the save, ending the condition on itself on a success.

spell.name: Raulothim's Psychic Lance
entries: You unleash a shimmering lance of psychic power from your forehead at a creature that you can see within range. Alternatively, you can utter a creature's name (a pseudonym, title, or nickname doesn't work). If the named target is within range, it becomes the spell's target even if you can't see it. If the named target isn't within range or you use an invalid name, the lance dissipates without effect.

The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 7d6} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Summon Astral Entity

m.text: a gem or crystal worth 300+ GP

entries: You call forth the spirit of a psionic entity. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the {@creature Psionic Spirit|XUA2025Psion} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose Crystal Entity, Ectoplasmic Entity, or Ghostly Entity. The creature resembles an astral entity of that kind, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} Psychic damage, and it can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, not both. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Telekinetic Crush
entries: You create a field of crushing telekinetic force in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} within range. Each creature in the area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Telekinetic Fling

m.text: an Arrow, Bolt, Bullet, or Needle worth at least 1 CP

entries: You brandish the ammunition used to cast this spell and fire it at a creature within range using psionic energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage, and the ammunition is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

trait.name: Incorporeal Passage (Ectoplasmic Entity and Ghostly Entity Only)
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If the spirit ends its turn in such a space, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage for every 5 feet traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Crystal Strike (Crystal Entity Only)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3} + the spell's level Piercing damage.

action.name: Ectoplasmic Splash (Ectoplasmic Entity Only)
entries: {@atkr r} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, range 30 feet. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 3} + the spell's level Psychic damage. {@hom}Each creature in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from and including the target has its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced by 5 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ephemeral Ray (Ghostly Entity Only)
entries: {@atkr r} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, range 120 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3} + the spell's level Psychic damage.

reaction.name: Shard Swarm (Crystal Entity Only)
entries: {@actTrigger} The spirit is hit by a melee attack roll. {@actResponse} The spirit halves the damage (round down) it takes from that attack. The spirit can then teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself.

table.name: Core Psion Traits
rows: {@i Choose 2:} {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Persuasion}

{@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, 2 {@item Dagger|XPHB|Daggers}, {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB}, {@item Bolts (20)|XPHB|20 Bolts}, {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|XPHB|Case}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 6 GP; or (B) 50 GP

table.name: Metamorph Spells
rows: {@spell Alter Self|XPHB}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}

table.name: Psi Warper Spells
rows: {@spell Expeditious Retreat|XPHB}, {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, {@spell Shatter|XPHB}

tables.name: Level 2 Psion Spells
tables.caption: Level 2 Psion Spells
rows: {@spell Tasha's Mind Whip|XUA2025Psion} (appears in this UA)

tables.name: Level 3 Psion Spells
tables.caption: Level 3 Psion Spells
rows: {@spell Summon Astral Entity|XUA2025Psion} (appears in this UA)

tables.name: Level 4 Artificer Spells
tables.caption: Level 4 Artificer Spells
rows: {@spell Raulothim's Psychic Lance|XUA2025Psion} (appears in this UA)

table.name: Psykinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Cloud of Daggers|XPHB}, {@spell Levitate|XPHB}, {@spell Shield|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB}
{@spell Slow|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinetic Crush|XUA2025Psion} (included in this UA)

table.name: Telepath Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB}

data.name: Unearthed Arcana 2025: The Psion
entries: This playtest document is part of a series of {@i Unearthed Arcana} articles that present material designed for upcoming books. The material here uses the rules in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}.

entries.name: Learn More on YouTube
entries: To learn more about the design in this article, we invite you to view the videos about it on YouTube ({@link www.youtube.com/DNDWizards}).

items.name: Psion
entries: The first new class since the {@class Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates}, the Psion weaves magic through the power of their mind.

items.name: Subclasses
entries: Four subclasses provide unique identities for a Psion character: {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psi Warper|Psi Warper|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psykinetic|Psykinetic|XUA2025Psion}, and {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Telepath|Telepath|XUA2025Psion}.

items.name: Spells
entries: A collection of spells, both familiar and new, enhance the options available to the Psion.

items.name: Wild Talents
entries: Also included are a collection of feats that provide characters with a way to tap into psionic powers. Backgrounds representing their connection to wild talents will be included with these feats in a future book if they become official, but in the meantime a character who takes the {@background Noble|XPHB} or {@background Sage|XPHB} background can choose a Wild Talent feat in place of that background's Origin feat, and any character can choose one of these feats when their class normally allows a feat choice.

entries.name: This Is Playtest Material
entries: This article is presented for playtesting and feedback. The options here are experimental and in draft form. They aren't officially part of the game. Your feedback will help determine whether we adopt it as official.

items.name: How to Playtest This UA
entries: We invite you to try out this material in play. To play with this material, you may either incorporate it into your campaign or run one or more special playtest sessions. For such a session, you may create an adventure of your own or use a short adventure from a source like {@adventure Quests from the Infinite Staircase|QftIS}.

items.name: Power Level
entries: The character options you read here might be more or less powerful than options in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}. If a design survives playtesting, we adjust its power to the desirable level before publication. This means an option could be more or less powerful in its final form.

items.name: Feedback
entries: The best way for you to give us feedback on this material is in the survey we'll release on D&D Beyond. If we make this material official, it will be refined based on your feedback, and then it will appear in a D&D book.
Providing feedback on this document is one way you can help shape the future of D&D!

entries.name: Psion
entries: {@i A Master of Psionic Power}

Psions weave magic and extraordinary powers through the power of their minds. They develop their minds as fonts of power that manifest spells and grow stronger over the course of their adventuring careers. You can find everything you need to play one of these psionic powerhouses in the next few sections.

entries.name: What is a Psion?
entries: Psions are spellcasters who use innate mental powers to gain extraordinary abilities and unleash the magic of their minds. Psions and their magic (sometimes called "psionics") can trace their history back to the appendix of the first edition {@i Player's Handbook}, and a psionics-using class first appeared in {@i The Complete Psionics Handbook} in 1991. Psionics have taken numerous forms in D&D, from alternative magic systems to options that dovetail with other D&D rules. In the fifth edition, psychic power is synonymous with magic, and the magic of the mind flavors numerous spells, monsters, and subclasses—like the {@class Fighter|XPHB|Psi Warrior Fighter|Psi Warrior|XPHB} and the {@class Sorcerer|XPHB|Aberrant Sorcery Sorcerer|Aberrant|XPHB} in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB}. In this edition, the Psion is a spellcaster who interfaces with magic and spellcasting similarly to other classes in the game.

This UA provides the Psion with unique twists to spellcasting using Psionic Energy Dice and the {@classFeature Spellcasting|Psion|XUA2025Psion|1|XUA2025Psion|Psionic Spellcasting} feature, carving out a space to make the Psion stand out from its spellcasting peers.

entries.name: As a Level 1 Character
items: Gain all the traits in the {@table Core Psion Traits|XUA2025Psion} table.
Gain the Psion's level 1 features, which are listed in the Psion Features table.

entries.name: As a Multiclass Character
items: Gain the Hit Point Die from the {@table Core Psion Traits|XUA2025Psion} table.

Gain the Psion's level 1 features, which are listed in the Psion Features table. See the {@variantrule Multiclassing|XPHB} rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB} to determine your available spell slots, adding all your Psion levels.

entries.name: Psion Class Features
entries: As a Psion, you gain the following class features when you reach the specified Psion levels. These features are listed on the Psion Features table.

entries.name: Psionic Discipline Options
entries: Psionic Discipline options appear in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Psion Spell List
entries: This section presents the Psion spell list. The spells are organized by spell level and then alphabetized, and each spell's school of magic is listed. In the Special column, {@i C} means the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, {@i R} means it's a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, and {@i M} means it requires a specific Material component.

entries.name: Psion Subclasses
entries: A Psion subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Psion levels, as specified in the subclass. This section presents the {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Metamorph|Metamorph|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psi Warper|Psi Warper|XUA2025Psion}, {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Psykinetic|Psykinetic|XUA2025Psion}, and {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion|Telepath|Telepath|XUA2025Psion} subclasses.

entries.name: Metamorph
entries: {@i Psychically Sculpt Life and Flesh}

entries.name: Psi Warper
entries: {@i Warp Space with the Power of Your Mind}

entries.name: Psykinetic
entries: {@i Mold Psionic Force for Creation and Destruction}

entries.name: Telepath
entries: {@i Master Tactics in the Landscape of the Mind}

entries.name: Spells
entries: Spells are presented in alphabetical order. If a spell includes the {@class Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates} in the parentheses after the spell's school of magic, that spell is added to the Artificer's spell list (use the most recent version of the {@class Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates} that appeared in Unearthed Arcana).

entries.name: Design Note: Spell Updates
entries: Several spells from {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE} return in this article, alongside some brand-new spells. Here are the main updates to spells in this article:

items.name: General Updates
entries: Returning spells have been refined and brought in line with revisions in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}.

items.name: New Spells
entries: New spells in this article—{@spell Summon Astral Entity|XUA2025Psion} and {@spell Telekinetic Crush|XUA2025Psion}—add new options to various classes' spell lists. The {@class Psion|XUA2025Psion} also receives a unique cantrip, {@spell Telekinetic Fling|XUA2025Psion}.

items.name: Raulothim's Psychic Lance
entries: This spell has more guidance around using a creature's name to target it.

items.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: The spell now restricts only the target's ability to make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} on a failed saving throw.

entries.name: Feats
entries: These feats are in the Wild Talent category.
